task.title: Adding an Android service
task.shortdesc: Allows you to easily add a new service to an existing Android project. A service allows you to perform lengthy background operations or an API that can be called by other applications.

step.cmd: In the Package Explorer, right-click the project to which the service should be added and select NewAndroid Service.
Specify a name for your new Service subclass in Name.

By default the new service will not have a label of its own; the application's label will be used when necessary. If you want a specific label for this service, clear the Default option (next to the Label field) and then enter your preferred user-readable label.

If this service uses device capabilities for which the user must grant permission, specify them in the Permission area. These permissions will be added to the appropriate place in your application's manifest file. To specify a permission, click Add, select the needed permission, and click OK.

The New Android Service wizard will create the service with an empty onBind() method. If you will be implementing onCreate() and/or onStart(), select the appropriate options to include empty versions of those method as well.

taskbody.result: The service is created and added to the selected project. It is also opened in an editor view.
